text: just when it seemed to have calmed down
Cal buco has rumbled back into life it
might look spectacular but for people
living in the area it's proving
devastating the government's ordered
more than 2,000 people to leave their
homes many of them had only just
returned temporarily to sweep away the
debris from last week's eruptions looked
at them all it's tough to leave again
because we'd already removed all the
volcanic ash from the houses so now to
evacuate again well it's kind of hard in
prison Anthony I've never seen anything
like it's the only thing you can think
about other people and the animals the
animals are a real concern this is a
largely agricultural region and the
ashes carpeted fields making it
impossible for livestock to graze for
now the situation is under control it
don't wilshire but this is a much
smaller eruption than the other two
we've seen especially the first one
we're talking about a column of ash and
smoke no bigger than four kilometers in
height it's heading south from the
volcano specifically towards the
southwest but the worry is that it could
intensify and that Cal buco could keep
on spewing ash and smoke for days if not
weeks Gideon long BBC News Santiago
